Detailed Description

Utilities for mapping state id and other state-derived data to meaningful semantics and messages.

Member Function Documentation

bool StateHelper::CanDial ( const StateID &  state  )  [static]

Determine whether a call can be placed in the current state.

Calls can be placed only in STATE_REGISTERED state.

Parameters:
state from State#id.

bool StateHelper::CanHangUp ( const StateID &  state  )  [static]

Determine whether hanging up is allowed.

Hanging up is allowed at any time during dialing and any form of connected state, including hold and autohold, but not during the disconnection process or if it is known that the remote party has disconnected.

Parameters:
state from State#id.

bool StateHelper::CanHold ( const StateID &  state  )  [static]

Determine whether a connection exists and can be put on hold.

A call already on hold or autohold or not connected cannot be put on hold.

Parameters:
state from State#id.

bool StateHelper::CanRegister ( const StateID &  state  )  [static]

Determine whether the registration is allowed.

Parameters:
state from State#id.

bool StateHelper::CanRetrieve ( const StateID &  state  )  [static]

Determine whether it is possible to retrieve a call from any form of hold.

A call must be on hold or autohold to be retrievable.

Parameters:
state from State#id.

Determine whether the user is registered with a SIP registrar.
